Terry Gene Bollea, better known by his ring name Hulk Hogan, is a legendary American professional wrestler, actor, and television personality. Born on August 11, 1953, in Augusta, Georgia, Hogan rose to fame in the 1980s as a charismatic and muscular wrestler with a distinctive mustache and bandana.

Hogan began his wrestling career in the 1970s, competing in various regional promotions and eventually joining the World Wrestling Federation (WWF), now known as WWE, in 1983. He quickly gained popularity due to his "Hulkamania" persona, which emphasized his all-American image, mustache, and feisty wrestling style.

Throughout the 1980s, Hogan became a household name, holding multiple championships and headlining numerous WrestleManias, the WWF's flagship event. He formed a legendary tag-team with "Macho Man" Randy Savage and feuded with the likes of Andre the Giant, "Ravishing" Rick Rude, and "Million Dollar Man" Ted DiBiase.

In the 1990s, Hogan transitioned to the World Championship Wrestling (WCW) organization, where he continued to wrestle and hold championships. He made his acting debut in the 1980s, appearing in films such as "Rocky III" and "Suburban Commando."

Hogan was inducted into the WWE Hall of Fame in 2005 and was named the number one wrestling star of all time by the WWE in 2009. He has continued to make sporadic appearances for various wrestling promotions and has been involved in various business ventures, including a reality TV show and a line of energy drinks.

Despite facing personal controversies and scandals throughout his career, Hulk Hogan remains one of the most recognizable and beloved figures in professional wrestling history.
